member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.QuickBuild.IO.CogIODeviceList
member.summary:
CogIODeviceList holds all I/O device objects that can be found in the system. However, this class can be used to add, remove or return a reference to the device object. See CogJobManager IODeviceList for getting references to devices in the system.
Note: CogJobManger should only instantiate this class.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.QuickBuild.Implementation.Internal.CogMCBAPI.CreateMccBoard(System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads "Measurement Computing" section of VisionPro.ini to retrieve the strong assembly name for the Measurement Computing "Universal Library". Once the assembly is loaded successfully using this assembly name, this method creates an instance of MccBoard and returns a reference to it. The caller may then use this object to access properties and methods via reflection. Cognex internal use only.
member.param: Zero based index of the desired MCC board.
member.returns: Reference to the MccDaq object.
member.exception: Thrown when "Measurement Computing" section cannot be located within VisionPro.ini.
Thrown if MccDaq.dll fails to load.
Thrown if a valid board with the specified number is not created. within VisionPro.ini.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.QuickBuild.IO.CogIOMCBPortNumberConstants
member.summary: The CogIOMCBPortNumberConstants are used to refer to a specific port on the Measurement Computing PCI-DIO24/S board. There are four ports: A, B, CL, and CH. Ports A and B are each 8 bits, while ports CL and CH are each 4 bits. If you are using the 8-line version of the Measurement Computing PCI I/O board, its lines are presented through ports CL and CH (lines 16 through 23).

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.QuickBuild.IO.CogIOMCBPortNumberConstants.PortA
member.summary: Lines 0 through 7. May be configured as either input or output.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.QuickBuild.IO.CogIOMCBPortNumberConstants.PortB
member.summary: Lines 8 through 15. May be configured as either input or output.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.QuickBuild.IO.CogIOMCBPortNumberConstants.PortCL
member.summary: Lines 16 through 19. May be configured as either input or output.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.QuickBuild.IO.CogIOMCBPortNumberConstants.PortCH
member.summary: Lines 20 through 23. May be configured as either input or output.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.QuickBuild.IO.CogIOMCB.SetLineEnabled(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Specify whether or not the indicated line on this device is enabled. If you set this to false for a given line, you will be prevented from writing to or reading from that line. If a heartbeat is already running on this line, it will not be affected, but you will be prevented from restarting it once you have stopped it.
member.param: The line number. Must be in the range 0 to 23 inclusive.
The desired state of the line.
member.event: Fires when a line's Enabled value is changed.
member.exception: If this CogIOMCB object has already been disposed.
If the line argument is less than zero or greater than 23.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.QuickBuild.IO.CogIOMCB.SetLinePulseWidth(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the pulse width, in milliseconds, for the specified line on this device. This parameter is used by the WriteSyncPulse(). If you set this to a new value while a heartbeat is already running on this line, the heartbeat will not be affected. If you then stopped and subsequently restarted the heartbeat on this line, it would reflect this new pulse width value.
member.param: The line number. Must be in the range 0 to 23 inclusive.
The desired pulse width, in milliseconds.
member.event: Fires when a line's PulseWidth value is changed.
member.exception: If this CogIOMCB object has already been disposed.
If the line argument is less than zero or greater than 23.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.QuickBuild.IO.CogIOMCB.GetLinePolarity(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get the polarity for the specified line on this device. With possible values of CogIOLinePolarity.LowToHigh or CogIOLinePolarity.HighToLow, this parameter is used by the Write(), SetValue(), and WriteSyncPulse() methods.
member.param: The line number. Must be in the range 0 to 23 inclusive.
member.returns: The polarity for the specified line on this device. May be either CogIOLinePolarity.LowToHigh or CogIOLinePolarity.HighToLow.
member.exception: If this CogIOMCB object has already been disposed.
If the line argument is less than zero or greater than 23.

member.param: The line number. Must be in the range 0 to 23 inclusive.
member.event: Fires when a line's Polarity value is changed.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.QuickBuild.Implementation.Internal.CogIOTCPIP._clientAutoConnect
member.summary:
True when the client device must automatically try to reconnect to the server when its connection is lost. There is no guarantee that the connection can be made again. Calling this routine will not automatically start the reconnection if the device is not already opened. It has no impact if the device is already closed. Set ClientAutoReconnect equals to true followed by Open(). If Open() fails, it will kick off a thread whose responsibility is to perform auto-reconnect.
This value can be set to false, while the device is open. This means when the connection is lost, it will not attempt to reconnect to the server.
Auto retry feature turns on when CogJobManager goes online, and turns off when it goes offline automatically.
This call is not thread safe.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.QuickBuild.Implementation.Internal.CogIOTCPIP._IOEnabled
member.summary: For internal use only. This should only be called from CogJobManager.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.QuickBuild.Implementation.Internal.CogIOTCPIP.Open
member.summary: This method does everything necessary to establish a valid communication channel with the specified properties. That includes creating the low-level device object (e.g. a socket), ensuring that the output queue is correctly sized and initially empty, and ensuring that the input buffer is empty. This method does nothing if IsDeviceOpen is already true

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.QuickBuild.Implementation.Internal.CogIOTCPIP._syncClose
member.summary: This function closes the socket and stops transmitting or receiving data immediately. All unsent data will be ignored. Warning: This function does not check whether the device is open This routine can be called from Open. Multiple threads might call this routine at the same time. One from either the read or write thread, or the other from a job's or job manager's thread. Since Close happens asynchronously, we want only one thread to finish it, and force the other threads to wait until its completion.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.QuickBuild.Implementation.Internal.CogIOTCPIP.CloseServer(System.Boolean)
member.summary: This function closes the socket and stops transmitting or receiving data immediately. All unsent data will be ignored. Warning: This function does not check whether the device is open This routine can be called from Open

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.QuickBuild.Implementation.Internal.CogIOTCPIP.Close
member.summary: This function closes the socket and stops transmitting or receiving data immediately. All unsent data will be ignored. Warning: This function should never be called directly. It should only be called from CogIOStreamDeviceManager

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.QuickBuild.Implementation.Internal.CogIOTCPIP.Timeout
member.summary: This timeout value is used for acknowledgement, sending and receiving data. For Acknowledgment: When AckEnabled is true, this is the maximum number of milliseconds that this deviceâ€™s output processing thread will wait for an acknowledgement message. If this timeout is exceeded, the output processing thread will retransmit the message. This will be repeated up to AckNumRetries times. If the message is not acknowledged, the output processing thread generates an Error event. For other cases: It will throw a timeout error when it fails to successfully either send or the entire data.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.QuickBuild.Implementation.Internal.CogIOTCPIP.Host
member.summary: This property identifies the computer to which results will be sent and from which commands will be read. This string may be in the form of an IP address, that is, a 32-bit integer expressed as four 8-bit values separated by periods, such as â€œ127.205.42.9â€. When Open() is called, this string will be evaluated to determine if it is in the form of an IP address. If it is then it will be used as such. If not, then we assume that this string is a host name which must be resolved using DNS. There is no default value.
